service is available from Delhi, 60 km away.

AC bus service is available from Anand Vihar (ISBT) Delhi to Bhaisali bus stand in Meerut.
Meerut is connected to Delhi by National Highway 58. National Highway 119 connects Meerut to the state of Uttarakhand.
Meerut city has 4 railway stations. All are well connected to Delhi and other parts of India.
Dr. Ambedkar Airport is a single-airstrip airport in Meerut which is used by government officials.

There are various options available to travel within the city. There is a good suburban city bus service connecting various parts of Meerut and its suburbs. Local rickshaws are also available, or one can hire a local taxi from any of the travel agents.

Beautiful Jain temples and Pandav Teela in Hastinapur town near the Ganges River are also "must see" attractions.

value: View of the campus of Venkateshwara Institute of Technology, one of several well-respected technical and engineering institutes in Meerut

Abu Lane, Begum Bridge Road and Central Market Shastri Nagar are good places to shop though modern shopping malls have also come up.

value: content=You can visit this market and taste some amazing pastries. Burgers are the best thing to have there.

You can buy different types of sports items in Meerut. Bats of Meerut are very popular. Companies like BDM , SS and SG are world famous.

is very famous in the city.

You can eat 23 different types of patties from egg to banana from the shop near Victoria Park (Bhamasah Park).

Gazak and Rewarees are very famous and can be bought from the bazaar near Jimkhana Maidan.

Naan khatai is another famous thing in Meerut.
